1.text: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him to Pilate.

2.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this man perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Cesar, saying, that he himself is Christ a king.

3.text: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest it.

4.text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests, and to the people, I find no fault in this man.

5.text: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to this place.

6.text: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.

7.text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged to Herodâ€™s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself was also at Jerusalem at that time.

8.text: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he had been for a long time, desirous to see him, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to see some miracle done by him.

9.text: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.

10.text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.

11.text: And Herod with his troops set him at naught, and mocked him, and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.

12.text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together; for before they were at enmity between themselves.

13.text: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests, and the rulers, and the people,

14.text: Said to them, Ye have brought this man to me, as one that perverteth the people: and behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man, touching those things of which ye accuse him;

15.text: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and lo, nothing worthy of death is done to him:

16.text: I will therefore chastise him, and release him.

17.text: (For of necessity he must release one to them at the feast.)

18.text: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this man, and release to us Barabbas:

19.text: (Who, for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)

20.text: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spoke again to them.

21.text: But they cried, saying, Crucify, crucify him.

22.text: And he said to them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him; I will therefore chastise him, and let him go.

23.text: And they were urgent with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified: and the voices of them, and of the chief priests prevailed.

24.text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

25.text: And he released to them him that for sedition and murder had been cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.

26.text: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.

27.text: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, who also bewailed and lamented him.

28.text: But Jesus turning to them, said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

29.text: For behold, the days are coming, in which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bore, and the breasts which never nourished infants.

30.text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

31.text: For if they do these things in a green tree, what will be done in the dry?

32.text: And two others, who were malefactors, were led with him to be put to death.

33.text: And when they had come to the place which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors; one on the right hand, and the other on the left.

34.text: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them: for they know not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

35.text: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them derided him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he is Christ the chosen of God.

36.text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,

37.text: And saying, If thou art the King of the Jews, save thyself.

38.text: And a superscription also was written over him, in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

39.text: And one of the malefactors, who were hanged, railed on him, saying, If thou art Christ, save thyself and us.

40.text: But the other answering, rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?

41.text: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

42.text: And he said to Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

43.text: And Jesus said to him, Verily I say to thee, This day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

44.text: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

45.text: And the sun was darkened, and the vail of the temple was rent in the midst.

46.text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he expired.

47.text: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

48.text: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

49.text: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off beholding these things.

50.text: And behold, there was a man named Joseph, a counselor: and he was a good man, and a just:

51.text: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them) he was of Arimathea, a city of the Jews; who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.

52.text: This man went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

53.text: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulcher that was hewn in stone, in which man was never before laid.

54.text: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

55.text: And the women also, who came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulcher, and how his body was laid.

56.text: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested on the sabbath, according to the commandment.
